alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 3:08AM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED TODAY INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... .Cooler air filtering in from high pressure building into Maritime Canada will allow a spring storm to bring a mix of wintry precipitation, mainly in the form of freezing rain and sleet in the advisory area. While precipitation is ongoing mainly across the mountains this morning, more widespread precipitation is expected to develop this afternoon and evening. Cooling temperatures this evening will see cold rain in the foothills and interior locations turn to freezing rain. Slick travel conditions are the primary hazard with this storm, especially after sunset, lasting through Thursday morning. Temperatures are expected to rebound above freezing through Thursday morning, bringing an end to freezing precipitation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to 2 inches, sleet accumulations around 1 inch and ice accumulations between one tenth and four tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Isolated power outages possible due to ice-weighted branches, especially at higher elevation with potential for wind gusts to near 30 mph. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
